seg.seg: (At a time when beings reached 80,000 years of age, there was the Buddha-god by the name of Vipaśyin. The good-natured venerable one obtained Buddhahood at the age of 19,000 years. For 45,000 years) he fulfilled the tasks of Buddhahood. Having forfeited 16,000 years of life,

he went into extinction. At the time when beings reached 70,000 years of age, there was the Buddha-god by the name of Śikhin. This one, too, the compassionate, obtained Buddhahood at the age 16,000 years. For 40,000 years

he fulfilled the task of Buddhahood. Having forfeited 14,000 years of life, he went into extinction. At the time when the beings reached 60,000 years of age, there was the Buddha-god by the name of Viśvabhū. This one, too,
(the master of masters,) obtained Buddhahood at the age of 13,000. For 35,000 years, he fulfilled the task of Buddhahood. Having forfeited 12,000 years of life,

he went into extinction. At the time when the beings reached 40,000 years of age, there was the Buddha-god by the name of Krakasundi. This one, too, the well-arrived one [su-gata], obtained Buddhahood at the age of 10,000.

For 22,000 years he exercised Buddhahood. Having forfeited 8,000 years of life, he went into extinction. At the time when beings reached 30,000 years of age, there was the Buddha-god by the name of Kanakamuni.
Als die Lebens[dauer] der wesen 30 000 Jahre war, war der (Buddha) namens Kanakamuni. Auch er, der Alleswissende, hat 8000jährig die Buddhaschaft erlangt.
When the life of the beings was [= lasted for] 30.000 years, there was a Buddha named Kanakamuni. He, too, the Omniscient, obtained the rank of Buddha at [the age of] 8000 years.
This one, too, the omniscient, obtained Buddhahood at 8,000 years of age. For 16,000 years, he exercised Buddhahood. Having forfeited 6,000 years of life,

he went into extinction. At the time when beings reached 20,000 years of age, there was the Buddha-god by the name of Kāśyapa. This one, too, the venerable, obtained Buddhahood at the age of 6,000 years. For 10,000 years he exercised Buddhahood.

Having forfeited 4,000 years of life, he went into extinction. At the time when the beings reached 120 years of age, there was the Buddha-god by the name of Śākyamuni. This one, too, the compassionate, obtained Buddhahood at the age of 35 years.

Als die Lebensdauer der Wesen 120 Jahre war (wtl. bei einem Leben der Wesen 120 Jahre [lang]), war der Buddha namens Śākyamuni. Auch er, der Mitleidige, hat 35jährig (die Buddhaschaft) erlangt. 45 Jahre hat er die Buddhaschaft ausgeübt [und] ist, 40 Jahre Leben übriggelassen habend, ins Nirvāṇa eingegangen.

When the lifespan of the beings was 120 years (lit. with a life of the beings 120 years [long]), [there] was a Buddha named Śākyamuni. He, too, the compassionate one, attained (Buddhahood) at the age of 35. For 45 years he practiced the Buddhahood [and] having left [over/behind] 40 years of life, he went into the nirvāṇa.
For 45 years he exercised Buddhahood. Having forfeited 40 years of life, he went into extinction. Now, at an age where the beings reach 80.000

years of age, you also obtained Buddhahood at the age of 19.000 years. You have [at your disposal] 45.000 years in which to exercise Buddhahood. || In (the) Pañcama (tune): || You obtained Buddhahood. You let turn
the excellent Wheel of the Law. You have performed the Mahāsamāja-(sūtra), the age of abundance, the consecration as Yugarāja and the thread of Karman and the descent from heaven.
After having exercised all these tasks of Buddhahood, having dismissed 16.000 years of life, you definitely have to go to nirvāṇa. 1. Thereupon the Buddha-god Maitreya reflected [upon this matter.]

"If I go to extinction today, by whom will be obtained the turning away [from the Saṃsāra]? The heart of many beings will break apart because of the separation from me, hot blood will go to their throat. Why should I not, for three months,

(1) (Wenn) ich (heute) ins Nirvāṇa eingehe, von wem wird [dann meine] Rückkehr erlangt [d.h. von niemandem wird dann meine Rückkehr erlangt]? Vielen Wesen wird durch die Trennung von mir das Herz brechen [und] heißes Blut zum Munde strömen [wtl. zur Mundhöhle gehen]. ODER (2) (Wenn) ich (heute) ins Nirvāṇa eingehe - für wen gibt es [da] eine Wiederkehr [d.h. für niemanden gibt es [da] eine Wiederkehr]? -, wird vielen Wesen durch die Trennung von mir das Herz brechen [und] heißes Blut zum Munde strömen.

(1) (If) I go to the nirvāṇa (today), by whom then will my return be effected? [i.e. nobody will effect my return]? The heart of many beings will break because of [their] separation from me [and] hot blood will flow [lit. go] to the mouth. OR (2) (If) I go to the nirvāṇa (today) - for whom is [there] a return [i.e. [there] is a return for nobody]? -, the heart of many beings will break because of the separation from ne [and] hot blood will flow to the mouth.

teach the Law that sees [the causes of the world], after having rejected the efforts pertaining to [long] life? Thereupon, The Buddha-god, Maitreya, after having rejected the efforts pertaining to [long] life, with resolve, he held on to living for three months. || In (the tune) Deva-

(-datta: || At this moment, the earth trembles,) the directions are burning, (the shooting stars) are raining [down], the terrifying drums (are roaring), the drum is heard with the clamor of spirits, the Yakṣas ...

p.note: Fragment of a manuscript which includes A 251 - A 294 (cf. 64-65).
The end of this passage corresponds to the Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra (Vg. 16.14, cf. 208-212). See 89-108 for commentary and the identification of the passage as belonging to the 27th act.
